primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God tests Abraham's radical trust by demanding the sacrifice of the promise (Isaac), only to provide the substitute Himself, pointing to the ultimate substitution in Christ.

subject.identificatie: God (as the primary mover and provider)
tekstueel_bewijs: God himself will provide the lamb
God was at the same time working through Abraham’s faith

object.identificatie: The preservation of the Promise/Salvation of the world
tekstueel_bewijs: the salvation of the whole world
the God who gives life to the dead
by you all the nations of the earth shall be blessed
brings you, too... to the threshold of faith
The ram was a substitute for Isaac, provided by God
He became the substitute for us

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not a moral failing but the ontological threat of the 'wipeout of the family future' and the 'loss of faith' itself.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer entering the 'strange country' of the Bible to find their true self.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The hearer is invited to enter the narrative world only after the primary soteriological drama of Abraham/Christ is established.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God himself will provide the lamb
God was... working through Abraham's faith
voorbeelden_mens_subject: you and I can undertake such an adventure
I invite you to undertake this daring activity

voorbeelden: Abraham being told by God to sacrifice Isaac
I want to live by its promises
the alien world of the Bible is the sphere where human beings are truly understood
God was able to do what he had promised
God was able to raise men even from the dead

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes God's 'Able-ness' (Pouvoir) over human 'Must-ness' (Devoir). Faith is defined by God's capacity to create from nothing.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the safety of the 'familiar' to the 'Abyss' (S2), then to the 'Substitute' (~S2) which leads back to 'Promise' (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God's intervention (The Ram/Christ) as the only way across the abyss.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the 'abyss' and 'horror' are not minimized.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. While it calls for 'radical trust,' it identifies God as the one who provides the object of that trust and the substitute for the sacrifice.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: I invite you to undertake this daring activity

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: What Abraham did not have to do, God did.
He became the substitute for us.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Abraham and Paul Lehmann are used as examples, but not as moral templates for the will; rather as 'offspring' of the promise whose faith is a gift of God's 'able-ness'.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: Abraham is the 'Receiver' of a promise God fulfills.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the burden of 'providing the lamb' is removed.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace; God provides what He demands.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the OT narrative to the Christological climax is seamless and structurally necessary.
spanning_punten: The tension between God's command (Devoir) and God's promise (Object).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The ram was a substitute for Isaac... He became the substitute for us.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses more on the Father's provision and the Son's substitution than the Spirit's indwelling.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; requires a death that only God can provide for.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary salvific verbs. Abraham is a 'Subject' of faith only because God is the 'Subject' of the Promise.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The sermon is a model of grace-oriented modal distribution.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Death/Abyss) is already sufficiently terrifying.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching that uses narrative tension to highlight the necessity of Divine intervention.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'strange country' metaphor, Greimas reveals that the metaphor serves to shift the hearer from Subject to Receiver.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Canaanite context; Greimas shows how the actantial roles of Isaac and the Ram are swapped by God.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes the 'Subject-Switch' at the climax: what Man (Abraham) is commanded to do, God (Subject) actually performs.

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'Be like Abraham' trap by focusing on the 'God of Abraham'.
